title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dallas Baptist University (Dallas, TX) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Steady communication in emailing and quick turnaround to my supervisors. They asked general interview questions and required stories of experience/motivation. It is expected that you hold your own but very friendly, kind, and godly!
Interview Questions: One thing asked was, “when was a time within your previous experience that you had to solve a problem with another coworker”

title: Production Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Dallas Baptist University (Dallas, TX) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: This interview was laid back with no pressure. They were hiring student workers, so there was not a high bar set for qualifications and experience. Other interviews for similar jobs have not been this easy, but still nothing too rigorous.
Interview Questions: What's your experience in the field

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Dallas Baptist University (Dallas, TX) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: I put in an application. They took months to get back to me. A video interview was scheduled. The interviewer was not very good at questioning. I was not made more confident by the interview process, this is something that I am accustomed to.
Interview Questions: Tell us a little about yourself.

title: Videographer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dallas Baptist University (Dallas, TX) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Past experiences with what have done with photography or videography and the explanation of the position. Basic questions regards to the purpose of work and why I want to get this job and which area I want to grow in
Interview Questions: Past experiences with what have done with photography or videography and the explanation of the position. Basic questions regards to the purpose of work and why I want to get this job and which area I want to grow in

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Dallas Baptist University (Dallas, TX) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was easy. I went to career services, got an application, and it was just basic interview questions. What are your best qualities, worst qualities, what do you bring to the team, etc.

title: Financial Aid Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dallas Baptist University (Dallas, TX) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: Short and concise. No personal questions just experience. Supervisor seemed nice. Office was clean and questions were simple. She did ask for my age which I thought was interesting. She also asked for my current salary.
Interview Questions: What is one of the best qualities about you.

title: IT Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dallas Baptist University in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: There was an application that I had to fill out and then I had one interview round. The application took a lot of time getting back to me, but once it got through it was pretty quick from there.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: International Student Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Dallas Baptist University in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: ISS leadership was in transition, so I was interviewed by four different people, but they were all very kind and encouraging. It took weeks for me to get through the interviews, but it was worth it.
Interview Questions: I was required to "help a student" edit their paper as I would with a real international student.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dallas Baptist University (Dallas, TX) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I met with the assistant director and we discussed expectations and requirements. this was not difficult it was very relaxed and more of a get to know you type of interview.
Interview Questions:
Do you plan to stay and get your masters? 

If so what in and what are your long term goals?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dallas Baptist University (Dallas, TX) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with the leadership of the division I was applying for and was asked straightforward questions about my experience in relation to future goals. Answered several questions relating to prior work experience and situational awareness to handle different portions of the job responsibilities assigned to me.

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Dallas Baptist University (Dallas, TX) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: There were multiple interview. These included the assistant dean, dean and provost. Everyone involved was kind and interviews were actually enjoyable. The first time I can say that. The process was fairly lengthy but nothing extraordinarily difficult.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your involvement in your church

title: Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dallas Baptist University (Dallas, TX) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward interview process. Consisted of one phone interview and a 30 minute in person meeting with the person who would be my highest accessible supervisor. Each asked questions about my personal goals, and prior experiences that make me right for the position.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dallas Baptist University (Dallas, TX) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Typical honest interview. The interviewer evaluated my resume and seemed to ask questioned based on what I wrote. I waited a couple of days and received a call to come back in where I was then offered the position.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress and pressure?

title: Information Technology Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Dallas Baptist University (Dallas, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Discussed the position with HR, then department head, and finally met with the university president. Personally my hiring occurred quickly, but I did see others take longer. Personality type and cohesion with existing employees was stressed just as much as technical competence, which was nice. Could take a week or two to hear back regarding status between steps, but again my personal experience went a bit quicker than others I witnessed later on.
Interview Questions: What are your life passions? What is your relationship with Christ like? etc.

title: Cashier's Office Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Dallas Baptist University (Dallas, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very lengthy, and detailed. I was given speech after speech about how to be successful etc...they really do care about students wellbeing and livelihood. It took around 4 weeks to ever hear back from them though, but I did get a second interview with the VP of finance. The second interview felt like an interrogation of sorts. Overall a long and stressful process but they have to be thorough to hire good and capable people.
Interview Questions: They hounded me about keeping my grades up

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dallas Baptist University (Dallas, TX) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Started with direct supervisor, assistant director and head of department. Interview is not very complicated. They ask simple questions. Sometimes personal background, work experience, etc. They are very friendly when you do interview. Setting the interview time might take while. Very good experience with interview.
Interview Questions: Do you have any work experience?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Dallas Baptist University (Dallas, TX) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Hiring begins when you fill out a standard DBU application. The Information Technology dept. requires students to submit the application, personality test results, class schedule, unofficial transcript, and resume to the Support office. 

I was interviewed by 4 separate staff members over the 4 weeks after my submission.

The first interview was with 2 members of Support staff. They were the managers I would be working for if I was hired. It was good to meet them early on and get to know what the job would be like.

The second interview was with the associate vice president of the department. He was very relaxed and encouraging. He wanted to know my background and what I enjoyed about school and things of this sort. He was friendly and helped the interview feel stress free.

The third and final interview was with the vice president of the department. This was the most difficult interview since he is kind but difficult to read. I was fairly relaxed until he started asking hypothetical questions about my personality test including one question that was phrased as though there was a correct answer.  However the interview went well and I was hired at the close of it.

I was able to start working the following week after filling out some minimal paperwork for payroll.
Interview Questions: I was asked if I would rather read a book or a poem on the last day of my life. It caught me by surprise and I answered a book to the surprise of the vice president who expected teh latter answer due to my personality assessment.  It was a bit discomforting after the interview since the question seemed to imply there was right answer and I had answered book since I am a speed reader and I could read a book in a day without issue.
